programme.title: Kolmeraudne
programme.desc: Vestlussaates Kolmeraudne on Mihkel Raua tuttavas raudses haardes on nadala kuumemad tegelased tipp-poliitikutest kultuurikorufeedeni, lisaks esineb igas saates uks ansambel.

programme.title: Kalamehejutud
programme.desc: Sel korral võistleme makrellipuugis ning saab ka naha, kes meeskonnast puuab landiga kinni arktilise linnu suula.

programme.title: Kalamehejutud
programme.desc: Kolime oma võttemeeskonnaga ookeanilt jarvele. Oma iluga lummab meid Lough Erne jarv, mille kaldal majutusasutust pidava Pascaliga laheme ahvenat puudma. Toomas Vara puuab landiga sarge ning tunnistame ka Prantsusmaa meistri vilumust landi tapsusloopimises.

programme.title: Kattemaksukontor
programme.desc: Kui miljonarist eksabikaasa keeldub õiglasest alimentide maksmisest, ei jaa naisel muud ule kui Kattemaksukontori poole poorduda. Detektiivid lubavad elatisraha valja nõuda, kuid selgub, et miljonar on oma varanduse osavalt teiste nimele kantinud.

programme.title: Kolmeraudne

programme.title: Power Hit Radio
programme.desc: Power Hit Radio - NON. STOP. MUSIC.

programme.title: Kodu keset linna
programme.desc: Kaisa kohtab Marekit, ent ei ole selle ule rõõmus. Marina ja Sten sõidavad Marina ema juurde. Robertile ei meeldi see. Helen tahab end mõnusalt tunda.

programme.title: Kodu keset linna
programme.desc: Annika ja Tom tulevad Hannese majja auto ostu tahistama. Andri helistab Lucyle ja kutsub teda tagasi. Liis saabub ootamatult koju. Helen on Henri sunnipaeva ara unustanud.

programme.title: Nurjatud tudrukud
programme.desc: "Nurjatud tudrukud" on musta huumori ja põnevusega vurtsitatud draamasari, mille tegevuspaigaks on raskestikasvatavate tudrukute kinnine õppeasutus. Sinna saabub eraeluprobleemide kaest põgenev kriminaalpsuhholoog Markus Tamm, kes satub silmitsi uute ja eelmisest veelgi keerulisemate probleemidega. Markusega samal paeval saabub kooli uus õpilane Hanna, kes on peamine kahtlusalune tuntud arimehe mõrvas.

programme.title: Kattemaksukontor
programme.desc: Kui miljonarist eksabikaasa keeldub õiglasest alimentide maksmisest, ei jaa naisel muud ule kui Kattemaksukontori poole poorduda. Detektiivid lubavad elatisraha valja nõuda, kuid selgub, et miljonar on oma varanduse osavalt teiste nimele kantinud.

programme.title: Padjaklubi
programme.desc: Kortermaja tabab haisurunnak ja Miša asub salaparast juhtumit uurima. Valja ilmub Ervin, kes on hakanud tunneli lõpus valgust nagema. Kristina saab pealtnaha lihtsa ulesande erakonda uks mees juurde varvata. Laura avastab et ta on andekas... verekaanide paigaldamises.

programme.title: Papad Mammad
programme.desc: Vaikel ja Ullal on meeste parast habi. Juri ja Volli pagendatakse linna. Mitskini vennast saab uha sagedam kulaline ja naised on temast võlutud. Vollil on linnas igav ja ta meelitab Juri linna peale. Juri arkab sinise silmaga, aga see on alles jaamae tipp. Papad saavad veel kuulsamaks, aga kahjuks negatiivses võtmes. Lahutused on silmapiiril.

programme.title: Narcos
programme.desc: Meeleheitel Jaime on burokraatliku paberimajandusega hadas. Mika muretseb oma abikaasa parast. Felix soovib, et Rafa kaoks.

programme.title: Kodu korda
programme.desc: Al on põnevil, sest Bob Vila on saates kulas ja annab oma uuele raamatule autogramme. Kodus tahab Tim, et Jill aitaks tal viktoriini kusimusteks valmistuda. Randy jaab koolis kiusamisega vahele.

programme.title: Kodu keset linna
programme.desc: Helen laheb Liisi parast minema. Marina on Steni peale sugavalt solvunud. Henri kardab, et Heike kolib tagasi. Annikal tuleb idee.

programme.title: Kodu keset linna
programme.desc: Henri ei tunne kõikidest kingitustest rõõmu. Marina ja Sten puhkavad teineteisest. Lucyl on Stenist hale. Liis lohutab Kaisat. Marina ei julge Roberti pool oobida.

programme.title: Resident
programme.desc: Bell kaalub Chastaini paastmiseks haigla muumist suurettevõttele, kuid Kit uritab teda veenda, et sellest tulenevad negatiivsed tagajarjed kaaluksid ules igasuguse kasu. Nic otsib Conradi abil Kylei ules ja palub teda, et ta kaaluks neeru annetamist Jessiele. Mina jagab oma muret Austiniga, kui Shira maaratakse Micah operatsiooni tegema. Devon võitleb selle nimel, et patsient, kellel arstide arvates puudub kindlustus, saaks ravi.

programme.title: Padjaklubi
programme.desc: Tudrukud murravad pead kahtlase taime ule, mille naabrinaine neile hoida tõi. Marial hakkab Margusest juba villand saama. Laura leiab uue too, kus saab ilus olla ja selfisi teha. Kristina satub peale kavaleride kaklusele.

programme.title: Kullakesed
programme.desc: Jõukas lesk, kellel on kaks vaikest last, palub Blancheil temaga abielluda.

programme.title: Papad Mammad
programme.desc: Papade ja Mammade eraelu laheb paev paevalt hullemaks. Juri oise kakluse meediasse jõudmine tahendab taas tootuks jaamist. Mitskini vend hakkab Vaike ja Ullaga tulevikku planeerima. Volli proovib endale kiiresti pruuti leida, et Vaiket armukadedaks teha. Otsingud paadivad uhe kodutuga, kes on lahkesti nõus Volli naist teesklema.

programme.title: Kattemaksukontor
programme.desc: Mõrvatud miljonar, kes kirjutas varanduse lahedaste nimele, polnud vist kunagi "Kuningas Leari" lugenud, sest tema varandus põhjustab uha uusi tulisid ja kuritegusid. Kattemaksukontoril tuleb valja mõelda kaval lõks, et mõrvar vahele võtta.

programme.title: Mõrv sai teoks
programme.desc: Modelli armuke, kes aitas Jessical uhte raamatut uurida, satub Pariisis mõrvari sihikule. Jessica seisab silmitsi kõrgmoe skandaaliga.

programme.title: Rannavalve
programme.desc: April uritab Mannyt aidata parast seda, kui ta elumuutva seljavigastuse sai. Neely alustab uut kattemaksuplaani Mitchi vastu. Alex uritab Neely ja Mitchi vahelisse tulli sekkuda.

programme.title: Resident
programme.desc: Kui Red Rock Mountaini haigla ule võtab, mattuvad Chastaini arstid uutesse reeglitesse ja on umbritsetud uute kolleegidega. Conrad satub ohtlikku olukorda, kui uue neurokirurgia keskuse ehitustood Chastainis gaasiplahvatuse põhjustavad. Samal ajal pannakse uus staar-neurokirurg Barrett Cain keerulise operatsiooniga proovile ja Mina toetab Nici, kes puuab kohutava kaotusega toime tulla.

programme.title: Beverly Hills, 90210
programme.desc: Lennyt suudistatakse ulikoolilinnaku vagistamises. Tõeline vagistaja jalitab Donnat ning rundab teda. Dylan saab Andrea ja Peteri afaarist teada. Donna suudistab Davidit Ray lahkumises.

programme.title: Nurjatud tudrukud
programme.desc: "Nurjatud tudrukud" on musta huumori ja põnevusega vurtsitatud draamasari, mille tegevuspaigaks on raskestikasvatavate tudrukute kinnine õppeasutus. Sinna saabub eraeluprobleemide kaest põgenev kriminaalpsuhholoog Markus Tamm, kes satub silmitsi uute ja eelmisest veelgi keerulisemate probleemidega. Markusega samal paeval saabub kooli uus õpilane Hanna, kes on peamine kahtlusalune tuntud arimehe mõrvas.

programme.title: V.E.R.I
programme.desc: 1995–1997 TV3 eetris jooksnud Eesti esimene haiglasari, kus intriigi hoidsid uleval arstide igapaevane too ja omavahelised suhted. Sarja kirjutas Peeter Urm, toimetas Mihkel Mutt, režissoor ja produtsent oli Toomas Kirss. Sarjas lõi kaasa Eesti naitlejate absoluutne paremik: Aarne Ükskula, Lembit Ulfsak, Guido Kangur, Ülle Kaljuste, Ita Ever, Ivo Uukkivi, Rita Ratsepp, Mait Malmsten, Kart Kross, Angelina Semjonova, Triinu Meriste, Mari Lill, Andrus Vaarik, Hans Kaldoja, Dan Põldroos, Eduard Toman, Juhan Ulfsak, Merle Palmiste, Ines Aru, Helene Vannari jpt. Sarja pealkiri V.E.R.I. moodustus sõnadest valu, elu, raha, ilu.

programme.title: Kalamehejutud
programme.desc: Endiselt kalastame Põhja-Iirimaal Lough Erne jarvistus ning selle saate eesmargiks on tabada võimalikult suur haug. Neid seal õnneks jagub.

programme.title: Kalamehejutud
programme.desc: Jatkuvalt veedame aega Põhja-Iirimaal, kus laheme Bushi jõele lõhet puudma. Tutvume ka kohalike Altandi lõhe kaitse aktivistide ning Belfastiga.

programme.title: Tulsa kuningas
programme.desc: Dwighti impeeriumi laienedes peab tema ja ta meeskond lahtised otsad kokku siduma.

programme.title: Kodu korda
programme.desc: Tim toob endale hada kaela, kui jatab vahele romantilise sõbrapaeva nadalavahetuse Jilliga, et rahuldada oma sponsori nõudmisi.

programme.title: Kodu keset linna
programme.desc: Liis raagib Hannesele oma kutist. Lucy lõikab endal tagasitee. Sten jõuab koju alles hommikul. Heike reedab Marinale olulise saladuse.

programme.title: Kodu keset linna
programme.desc: Maarja eestvõtmisel minnakse loomaaeda. Sten tahab teada, kes reetis Marinale saladuse. Maarja raagib Henrile tekipesast. Marina ei saa Robertilt oodatud lohutust.

programme.title: Resident
programme.desc: Kui Red Rock Mountaini haigla ule võtab, mattuvad Chastaini arstid uutesse reeglitesse ja on umbritsetud uute kolleegidega. Conrad satub ohtlikku olukorda, kui uue neurokirurgia keskuse ehitustood Chastainis gaasiplahvatuse põhjustavad. Samal ajal pannakse uus staar-neurokirurg Barrett Cain keerulise operatsiooniga proovile ja Mina toetab Nici, kes puuab kohutava kaotusega toime tulla.

programme.title: Padjaklubi
programme.desc: Kristina haistab lahenevaid pulmi ja hakkab oma kaalu parast muret tundma. Misha teeb endale lõpuks Facekooki konto ara. Maria loodab tool Kallet kohata, aga teda tabab hoopis teistsorti ullatus. Laura on hadas perverdist ulemusega.

programme.title: Kullakesed
programme.desc: Blanche osaleb taiskasvanutele mõeldud koolitusel ning õpetaja annab talle labiva hinde, kui mees temaga magab.

programme.title: Papad Mammad
programme.desc: Aina hullemaks laheb ja head lahendust ei paista kusagilt. Vaike on võtnud pahe, et kingib maja Mitskini vennale ja notari aeg pannakse paika. Ulla ja Juri otsustavad sõbralikult lahku minna ja korteri maha muua. Ulla võtab lolli peaga SMS-laenu. Volli plaan oma naisukest kodutuga armukadedaks teha laheb vett vedama, sest Vaike annab neile rohelise tule.

programme.title: Kattemaksukontor
programme.desc: Kattemaksukontori poole poordub murest murtud naine palvega kindlaks teha, kas ta mehel on armuke. Marion ja Luna tuvastavad kiiresti, et just nii see ongi, kuid samas selgub ka midagi, mis naib olevat nii uleloomulik, et sobiks pigem ulmefilmi.

programme.title: Mõrv sai teoks
programme.desc: Cabot Covei elanikud on mures kavandatava ulatusliku rannikuala arenduse parast. Jessica jaoks on olukord keeruline, sest arendusfirma annab tood ta vennapojale. Peagi algavad aga ametialased kuriteod ja mõrvad.

programme.title: Rannavalve
programme.desc: April ja Jessie otsivad kuulsust, kes juhiks Preili Galaktika võistlust. Manny uritab kohaneda oma uue eluga halvatuna. Newman puuab Alexi tahelepanu koita.

programme.title: Resident
programme.desc: Cain puuab varvata Belli ja Kiti ohtlikule operatsioonile, mille eesmark on haiglale avalikkuse tahelepanu tõmmata. Raptoril tekib emotsionaalne seos patsiendiga, kelle elu on tema kates, ja Mina sõber Adaku (kulalisnaitleja Erinn Westbrook) tuleb haiglasse šokeerivate uudistega. Devon lahkub esmaabi osakonnast ja Nic plaanib Conradile ullatuse teha.

programme.title: Beverly Hills, 90210
programme.desc: Brandon, Kelly, Donna ja Steve osalevad Clarei ja Davidi projektis. Valerie kolib Walsheide juurde tagasi. Dylan aitab Charliel filmistsenaariumi kallal tootada. Andrea kaalub Jesseile oma afaarist raakimist.

programme.title: Varjudemaa
programme.desc: Tallinnas edukalt karjaari teinud Rita peab naasma Saaremaale, kus ootamatult suri tema isa. Rita ei ole 20 aastat kodukulas kainud. Teda ootavad seal umbusklikud kohalikud, tumedad minevikuvarjud ja jahmatav tõdemus, et isa surm võis olla mõrv. Rita otsustab asja uurima hakata ja see seab ta silmitsi seni tundmatu pettuse, vagivalla ja hirmuga.

programme.title: Kalamehejutud
programme.desc: Taas jõuame ookeani aarde. Selleks, et minna haid puudma. Kas saatejuhid Kalev Kruus ja Toomas Vara saavad haipuugis kae valgeks? Igal juhul tahistame puuki legendaarses Gravediggers Pubis ja tahistame Kalevi sunnipaeva.

programme.title: Kalamehejutud
programme.desc: Sel korral kaib võistlus suurima hai puugile. Mis konkse, trossi ja sootu selleks vaja laheb? Huppame labi ka Dublinist.

programme.title: 101 East
programme.desc: From Al Jazeera network, 101 East is a groundbreaking series of investigative documentaries, exploring hard-hitting, controversial stories across Asia and the Pacific, providing a voice to unheard citizens of this region. Winning numerous plaudits and accolades, such as a Royal Television Society award, human rights awards and three Emmy nominations, the show sends journalists into the worlds most populous region to examine and expose stories of injustice and social disparities. Across the continent, examples of discrimination, inequality and oppression are pursued and perused, with 101 East helping to give the silenced a platform to speak.

programme.title: News Live

programme.title: Inside Story
programme.desc: Inside Story is a daily news programme broadcast by Al Jazeera English. The news programme provides a closer look at recent stories from the globe. Politics, extremism, elections in Europe, America and Africa, influence of artificial intelligence on our future, work of WHO and UN, economic crisis and its analysis by global news agencies, all of these and much more is covered by Inside Story so keep your finger on the past.

programme.title: Talk to Al Jazeera
programme.desc: Al Jazeeras flagship weekly show in which the channels journalists interview some of the most influential individuals on the planet on current and relevant socio-political issues. The conversations are focusing on important international and global topics. Join them in these informative one-on-one talks where leading politicians, entertainers, influencers and experts of various fields comment and share their opinions about different problems.

programme.title: The Listening Post
programme.desc: Current affairs programme that investigates, analyses and critiques the worlds media and all the important news, explaining how they operate and what are the stories they cover. The Listening Post is created and hosted by Richard Gizbert. Each episode includes in-depth reports, showing how the key stories of the week have been handled by the various worlds media, a segment known as The Download in which viewers comment on the featured stories, and brief news on general developments in world of journalism.

programme.title: 101 East
programme.desc: From Al Jazeera network, 101 East is a groundbreaking series of investigative documentaries, exploring hard-hitting, controversial stories across Asia and the Pacific, providing a voice to unheard citizens of this region. Winning numerous plaudits and accolades, such as a Royal Television Society award, human rights awards and three Emmy nominations, the show sends journalists into the worlds most populous region to examine and expose stories of injustice and social disparities. Across the continent, examples of discrimination, inequality and oppression are pursued and perused, with 101 East helping to give the silenced a platform to speak.

programme.title: Meteor
programme.desc: Meteor is a disaster mini-series about a meteor on a collision course with Earth. After NASA discovers a giant meteor named Kassandra that threatens to erase humanity of the planet, astronomer Dr. Lehman and his assistant Imogene ONeil must hurry to collect information about it. Lehman tragically dies along the way. Meanwhile, meteor showers are occurring worldwide causing panic. One of the towns hit by the meteorites is Taft in California. There, detective Jack Crowe is tries to find his ex partner Stark before he kills his daughter and father who is the sheriff of the town.

programme.title: Icon
programme.desc: Action, with Patrick Swayze. An American agent, living in Russia, agrees to help the British government investigate a mystery illness that hit the country just before the Russian elections.

programme.desc: Jane Doe ja tema meeskond uurib tunnustatud kunstiasjatundja surma ning hindamatu meistriteose kadumist muuseumi oksjonilt. Jane ja Frank loovad kampa kaunitarist kindlustuspettuste uurijaga, et leida kadunud maal. Frank on naisest kõrvuni sisse võetud, kuigi loo hargnedes selgub uha kindlamalt, et just see iludus võibki olla roovi ninamees.

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: Mystery drama featuring John Larroquette as a hard-nosed cop turned compassionate defence lawyer, who specialises in lost causes. His latest client is a failed actress who became a call girl out of desperation and is now accused of the brutal murder of a prominent Beverly Hills madam. McBrides investigations reveal that the victim was a blackmailer as well as a procurer, which considerably lengthens his list of suspects.

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: McBride agrees to give his accountant a hand in a bitter custody battle but when the man is accused of murdering his therapist, everything changes.

programme.title: Blackout
programme.desc: When Daniel Demoys wakes from an alcoholic blackout to find he has beaten a man to within an inch of his life, he begins a quest for redemption.

programme.title: Blackout
programme.desc: Daniel is elected mayor, but is quickly drawn into a web of deception in which no-one can be trusted. How long can he keep his dark secret from Alex?

programme.title: The Royal Scandal
programme.desc: Sir Arthur Conan Doyles Sherlock Holmes - the worlds greatest detective - faces a most alluring adversary... Legendary opera star Irene Adler is threatening to destroy the King of Bohemias reputation with proof of their illicit affair. The evidence? A photograph. Her ransom? The kings hand in marriage. But not only does investigating detective Sherlock Holmes already know Irene from the past, he also knows that the queen of manipulation would never resort to such a common crime. After uncovering her true ambitions, Holmes draws the cunning songstress into a well-matched game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: Merlins Apprentice
programme.desc: Awakened after a fifty year rest, the supreme sorcerer Merlin returns to Camelot to find the kingdom in ruins, depleted after the theft of the Holy Grail, its greatest form of protection. Seeking help, he employs the services of a young thief and beggar by the name of Jack, himself a man of magical talent. Merlin and Jack set out to discover the whereabouts of the Holy Grail, with Jack now his apprentice, but they find the kingdom on the brink of attack and doom. The 2006 two-part series is a sequel to the original 1998 series, with Sam Neill and Miranda Richardson reprising their roles as Merlin and the Lady of the Lake.

programme.title: Dinotopia
programme.desc: Based loosely on the novels by James Gurney, Dinotopia is a fantasy adventure series following two young brothers who wash up on the shore of the titular island, a magical lost paradise where humans and dinosaurs live together. Karl and David Scott are half-brothers enjoying a flight with their father on his private aircraft when tragedy strikes and the plane crashes to the ground. When they wash up on land, their adventure begins, learning about this hidden civilisation and begin to adjust to their surroundings. The three-episode show aired in 2002, starring Wentworth Miller, Tyron Leitso, and David Thewlis.

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong Islandil

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bradshaws 1913 Continental Railway Guide in hand, Michael Portillo visits Italy, where he experiences first-hand the nations need for speed in a state-of-the-art Maserati sports car. Michael discovers how the Leaning Tower of Pisa was rescued from near collapse. In Carrara, he finds out how the marble used by Michelangelo is still quarried today and is invited to chip away at a contemporary sculpture. In Bologna, he embarks on a doomed search for spaghetti bolognese, until a cookery teacher shows him how to make a much more authentic tagliatelle al ragu. Following in the footsteps of Bradshaws travellers, Michael explores the cradle of the Renaissance through Edwardian eyes. Heading north to Gargnano, Michael discovers the romantic hideaway of one of Britains most famous writers, DH Lawrence, whose affair with his professors wife scandalised his home country. Michael ends his journey in futuristic style with a high-speed boat trip across Lake Garda.

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Joe Swash and Seann Walsh are no strangers to jungles after appearing on Im A Celebrity..., but neither of them has sought an ancient Mayan temple in Guatemala before.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: As always, Ben joins a variety of brave folks who chose to venture down a very alternative path to everyday life. The aim is to discover the reality of leaving it all behind, and meet those who have chosen to ditch a life dominated by debts and the daily grind to go in search of something different. This week, Ben ventures to Central America and a remote island off the coast of Panama. His host Jaimie is an inventor who has built a unique home and an unconventional family, to create his own wild utopia. Ben gets stuck into island life, from scrubbing boat hulls and hacking through vegetation, to pedalo exercising and home schooling. He questions the unusual family dynamics in this house, and joins his eccentric host to sample his inventions—from a fart machine to cook on, to a computer game based on his life.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: In a nostalgic episode of Inside the Factory, new presenter Paddy McGuinness visits the Warburtons bread factory in his hometown of Bolton, where he once worked as a youngster more than 30 years ago. At Warbies, as the locals call it, he catches up with old friends and learns how the machines, ovens and conveyors he once cleaned enable the site to produce 1.4 million loaves of bread every week. As a fitting return to the factory, Paddy makes a grand entrance by driving a tanker of flour through the gates. As he manoevres his way to the intake area, he reveals that he was a young boy of sixteen when he worked here - it was a Saturday job, cleaning out the massive bread-making machines. However, the machines didnt run on Saturdays, which means that hes going to see them in action for the first time! With a little trepidation, Paddy dons the obligatory hairnet and steps inside the factory to soak up the memories. But he cant hang around reminiscing - theres sliced white bread to be made. So, he heads back outside to where he left his tanker full of flour. Head of Flour Stuart Jones tells him that they receive three tanker loads each day, containing a total of 90 tonnes - enough to make 170,000 loaves of bread. As the mix of British and Canadian flour is unloaded, Paddy heads back inside the factory, where he spots a familiar face - his old school friend Pete, who got him the Saturday job and still works at the factory. After a quick chinwag, Paddy heads to the dough-mixing area to meet someone with a very impressive title: Unbeatable Quality Manager, Rachel Bacon. Rachel tells Paddy that the key to making the best white bread is air bubbles; inside each slice there are 13,000 bubbles, which are all counted by computer. To make the dough, a mixer combines the flour with water and brine, along with yeast and a special ingredient called improver, which helps with the structure of the dough. After mixing for three minutes, the dough is tipped out and chopped into 341 separate pieces, each one weighing 920 grams. Every one of these mounds of dough will go on to make a loaf. The dough travels through a machine, which relaxes the strands of gluten inside and allows them to fully form, holding in the thousands of bubbles. Next, the dough is flattened and rolled out again - a bit like a Swiss roll. Then its chopped into four, turned 90 degrees and squashed together again. This method is called cross panning and gives extra strength to the finished loaves. Paddy and Rachel agree that its an important process, as it means that when you have a chip butty and want to roll the bread around the chips, it wont break. Paddys dough drops into tins and travels towards a huge machine called a prover, where Paddy meets another expert, Manufacturing Excellence Manager Joanna Whitehurst. This massive, warm room is kept at between 37 and 40 degrees Celsius, which is the perfect temperature for the yeast inside the dough to activate and feed on naturally occurring sugars - a process called fermentation. This releases carbon dioxide gas, causing the bubbles in the dough to expand and the loaves to rise. Once risen, a lid is placed on top of every tray, which gives the loaves a distinctive flat top. After two hours and forty minutes in production, the tins go into the 32-metre-long oven. Paddy tells Joanna that when he worked at the factory, he used to clean the ovens - and they were spotless! Twenty-one minutes after entering the oven, the bread is turned out of the tins, and the golden loaves stream along the conveyor for Paddy to see and smell them in all their glory. They are making sliced bread, so the slicing machine creates 17 slices for every loaf, each one is 13.7 millimetres thick. Finally, they are wrapped in traditional-style waxed paper, which helps to lock in the freshness. Paddy remembers his mother using the distinctive paper to wrap his sandwiches for school. As he heads to dispatch, Paddy bumps into his old mate Pete again. They reminisce about the old days at the bread factory. Paddy remembers not being able to get out of bed in the morning but having to walk to the factory in the cold and rain, ready to start his shift at 6.00am. Paddy watches as 6,000 loaves are loaded into the back of a lorry; the factory dispatches 44 wagons every day. With the soundtrack of M Peoples 90s anthem Moving on Up blasting out, Paddy loads the final trolley of sliced white bread into the lorry. Elsewhere in the episode, Cherry Healey visits the Dualit factory to learn how they make toasters and visits a brewery turning waste bread into pints of beer, while historian Ruth Goodman discovers why white bread was banned during the Second World War.

programme.title: Worlds Deadliest Weather
programme.desc: In Louisiana, Hurricane Ida destroys homes and lives. In Norway, High seas and high winds force a Captain to abandon ship. And in California, wildfires tear through the state.

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong Islandil
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong imetleb seekordses osas Islandi lõunaosa muda- ja laavavoogusid, mille sisse kukkumine tahendaks silmapilkset surma. Seejarel teeb ta kohustusliku kaigu liustikule, et imetleda looduse ilu ja vage. Kordalainud reisile pannakse punkt uhke pidusoogiga.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Setting sail to the magical island of Bali, Steve and the team are out to find the elusive ocean sunfish. These deep ocean giants feed on poisonous jellyfish and ascend to the shallows for a spa session at a cleaner fish station. Strong currents provide challenging conditions, and the dives have to be abandoned after the team run out of air, putting the hunt on hold! Heading inshore, Steve dives by a shallow reef to see what deadly contenders he can find. First is a lionfish, a beautiful but deadly predator with venomous spines and a lethally fast strike. Next, Steve comes across a pair of frogfish. These bizarre-looking fish have incredible camouflage and are among the best ambush predators in the ocean, blending into the reef and waiting for lunch to swim by before pouncing. The frogfish are extremely inquisitive and take up residence on cameraman Marks camera. Things turn serious when Steve discovers a ghost net choking the reef. The discarded fishing net is causing havoc - trapping a trumpetfish and stopping it joining its mate, and smothering an anemone and its resident clownfish. Bali is facing many environmental challenges, but it is taking a strong stand against plastic pollution, as many ocean animals are highly affected by the plastic in our seas. For the sunfish that prey on jellyfish, it can be fatal, as a plastic bag looks identical to their prey. The programme features the two young founders of Bye Bye Plastic Bags, who in January this year got the Balinese government to completely ban plastic bags on the island. Heading out on a beach clean-up and out into the ocean, Steve helps the island continue to keep their oceans and beaches clean.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo embarks on a Greek odyssey from Athenss port of Piraeus north to the city of Thessaloniki, captured the year before from the Ottoman Turks, who had ruled much of Greece for 400 years. Exploring the Acropolis and delighting in the tastes of moussaka and baklava, Michael discovers the many influences at play in the creation of modern Greece - from its classical past to the oriental Ottomans and the great European powers of Britain, France and Russia. Along the way, Michael discovers the parlous state of Greek finances at the time of his guidebook. He learns how an aristocratic English poet became a Greek national hero and relives Greek athletic victory at the first modern Olympic games.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben travels to the deserts of Arizona to meet Dee — a modern-day nomad travelling across the US. He discovers that disabled retiree Dee began her journey in a former military transport vehicle, which she has turned into a cosy home. The vehicle earned her the nickname Box Van Dee. Ben experiences first-hand how challenging it is to live out of a small vehicle in the arid surroundings of the inhospitable desert — travelling side-by-side with his host in his own tiny car. Together, they deal with the lack of space to cook nomad meals, collect water, dump their waste and repair solar panels on the roof of the car — while also embracing Dees creative activities and ways of finding friendship. Ben discovers how Dees life as a nomad is much more than a lifestyle change — it has allowed her to finally heal after a lifetime of trauma, and she has now become an internet sensation.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Join journeyman Ben Fogle as he visits snowboarding legend Mike Basich – a man who left the fame and riches of professional sport to reconnect with the natural environment and pursue a quieter life in the Sierra Nevada mountains. Ben joins him in his extraordinary hand-built log cabin and finds out how Mike got his kicks by pushing his body to the edge, explores why he left that lifestyle behind and joins him as he embarks on a life-changing project. Ben meets Mike in his winter snowscape utopia. Together they explore the mountain on skis and embrace Mikes genius for mechanics, metalwork and woodwork – which he has utilised for tree felling, solar electrics, a homemade hot tub and his very own ski lift. Ben discovers there are three sides to his host – mountain Mike, workshop Mike and family Mike and finds out how he makes these work together. Ben learns how when not one, but two disasters struck, a community rallied together to help Mike and his family on their new journey in the mountains.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Melting ice, open waterways, and extended daylight allow Alaskans to chase the opportunities of spring. Sue Aikens hunts the tundra for food but must remain wary of a recent injury.

programme.title: Dešifreeritud aarded
programme.desc: A stunningly preserved tomb in an ancient Egyptian city, containing the mummy of a nameless, murdered pharaoh. Treasures Decoded looks into the city of Cleopatra, lost for over 1,000 years.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Documentary series. Gregg Wallace helps to unload 27 tonnes of dried haricot beans from North America and follows them on a one and a half mile journey through the largest baked bean factory in the world, which makes more than three million cans of beans every 24 hours. Gregg discovers how a laser scrutinizes every single bean, how the spice recipe for the sauce is a secret known only by two people and how the beans are not baked at all! Cherry Healey follows the journey of a discarded baked bean can through a recycling centre and on to the largest steelworks in the UK. She also takes a can that is 14 months after its best before date to a lab at the University of Coventry and is amazed when tests reveal it has the same Vitamin C levels compared to fresh tomatoes. Historian Ruth Goodman reveals how tinned food was invented to prevent British seamen developing scurvy on their long voyages at sea. Ruth also relates how Henry Heinz first marketed baked beans in the UK in the early 1900s.

programme.title: Planeet Maa III
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough tutvustab meile salaparaseid metsi, kus kõik elav on omavahel teinekord kõige ootamatumal kombel seotud.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures deep into the Black Forest on a quest to discover the essence of Germany and discovers how Hansel and Gretel helped to unify the nation. A humbling masterclass in carving cuckoo clocks shows him how the nations reputation for quality and reliability in manufacturing was established from the early 18th century. A romantic stop at the ruined Schloss in Heidelberg follows before Michael gets an insiders guide to share dealing on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. At Goettingen University, Michael discovers two sides of student life at the turn of the 20th century - the duelling fraternities and the groundbreaking scientists who laid the foundation for Germanys world-class transport technology today. Braving the force of the Goettingen wind tunnel, Michael investigates the track where model trains are fired at up to 360km per hour.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Changing landscapes and animal patterns threaten the survival of those who dwell in the arctic. The Hailstones search for a once abundant food source quickly turns to desperation.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben journeys to South America to visit Rhona, a British-born actress who left Hollywood to live alone in a remote valley in Uruguay. He learns that a difficult childhood and disillusionment with Tinseltown culture led to his hosts new life. She is now committed to rehabilitating horses and the pair attend an animal auction looking to rescue any mistreated animals. Series/ Exec Prod: Natalie Wilkinson; Prod Co: Renegade Pictures

programme.title: Dešifreeritud aarded
programme.desc: Hadrians Wall once formed the N/W frontier of the Roman Empire. However new evidence reveals how the ruthless Roman military crossed over and took the fight to their enemy.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a scenic, thousand-mile rail journey from the Swedish capital, Stockholm, to Abisko in the northern reaches of the Arctic Circle. Steered by his 1936 edition of Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide, Michael boards a steam train to celebrate Midsummer in Marielund, learns to decorate a Dala horse in Mora and takes an icy dip in one of the countrys 96,000 lakes. In Stockholm, Michael braves a precarious tour of the city from its rooftops before boarding a heritage tram to get the lowdown on 1930s Sweden from an expert. At the capitals Royal Institute of Technology, Michael investigates the transport of the future in a near-vacuum tube. He tours Uppsala University and takes Swedens 1,300km Inlandsbanan railway, which was completed in 1937, to travel north to Ostersund and Kiruna. Michael finishes deep in the Arctic Circle at a remote climate research station, where scientists are building on data recorded at the time his guidebook was published. En route, Michael learns why Sweden built the strategic inland railway on which he is travelling. He discovers how the nation created a welfare state, has lunch with traditional Sami people in Vilhelmina and checks into a chilly hotel made of ice.

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Former Soccer Saturday buddies Jeff Stelling and Chris Kamara reunite for an epic journey across Sri Lanka where they reaffirm their friendship along the way.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben heads to Africa to meet a master bushman who quit a city career for the dry and dusty desert.

programme.title: Empire with David Olusoga
programme.desc: How did a small island create the biggest empire the world has ever seen? David Olusoga uncovers a living legacy.

programme.title: Puude salajane elu
programme.desc: In this second episode we discover how trees have developed the art of growing and ageing gracefully as they pass from their early years into middle age. We see how they do incredible things in the prime of their lives, how they talk to one another, and even work together to thrive in an often turbulent world. Arriving at adulthood is a major milestone in a trees life. Some fruit trees get there early, maturing at as young as 5 years old, whereas some trees like North American hemlocks can take 300 years to become an adult. Early in the morning we see a glorious English Oak as it wakes up, stretching its branches as much as 10cm with the rising sun. At 75 years old, this oak tree is just reaching adulthood, and already plays host to more than 2,000 different insects and creatures – more than any other native British tree. Every tree has lodgers but not all are friendly. In Scotland amongst an avenue of hornbeams, we reveal the incredible details of how trees communicate, using chemical smells to warn each other of attacking predators. Trees have found ingenious ways to thrive in all sorts of hostile landscapes, including our very busiest cities. The Cheapside Plane is believed to be the oldest living tree in the City of London. London plane trees have a nifty trick to thrive amongst the capitals polluted streets: sloughing off their bark after it has absorbed the grime around them. Trees can overcome many perilous conditions; on the edge of the Arctic circle entire forests of dwarf willows and birches grow no taller than a metre to protect themselves from the freezing winds. And in the summer heat of Tuscany, Cypress trees produce cones that only open with fire or extreme heat; an amazing way to survive against the growing threat of wildfires. But its often below the ground where trees hold their greatest secrets. In the rolling hills of Dorset, beneath the tree line, is a magical sunken lane called a Holloway. Its here that the wonderful world of tree roots are on display. A growing tree can have up to 30 miles of roots, 90% of which are actually found in the top 10cm of the soil, working hard to feed the tree and keep it upright as it battles the elements. But theres even more to a trees underground world. In Wales theres a rare piece of rainforest. The forest floor is covered with colourful mushrooms and toadstools; this is all we can see of an incredible network of fungi that runs underground with threads that connect the roots of many different trees. Some experts believe that these networks actually allow trees to talk to each other, or even help each other by passing nutrients between them. Finally, at Kew Gardens, we learn how trees can heal themselves when they are damaged. We meet Kews unluckiest tree, a Corsican pine, that has been struck by lightning twice. The energy of a lightning strike can be as much as a million volts, splitting a tree in two. Luckily the strike on the pine was just on its bark; when trees are injured they are vulnerable to infection but remarkably trees like the Corsican pine can seal their wounds to stop the infection spreading. Trees can survive extraordinary things, from wildfire to lightning strikes, and time after time they show their incredible strength and resilience to live incredibly long lives.

programme.title: Secret Amazon
programme.desc: Lucy plunges further into the unknown reaches of the Amazon, coming face to face with hostile giant wasps, caiman-infested rivers, and more deadly snakes.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo embarks on a Greek odyssey from Athenss port of Piraeus north to the city of Thessaloniki, captured the year before from the Ottoman Turks, who had ruled much of Greece for 400 years. Exploring the Acropolis and delighting in the tastes of moussaka and baklava, Michael discovers the many influences at play in the creation of modern Greece - from its classical past to the oriental Ottomans and the great European powers of Britain, France and Russia. Along the way, Michael discovers the parlous state of Greek finances at the time of his guidebook. He learns how an aristocratic English poet became a Greek national hero and relives Greek athletic victory at the first modern Olympic games.

programme.title: Secret Amazon
programme.desc: Lucy plunges further into the unknown reaches of the Amazon, coming face to face with hostile giant wasps, caiman-infested rivers, and more deadly snakes.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve ventures to the wilds of Gabon for the first time. He heads to the incredible Loango National Park on the western coast of Gabon, home to some awesome deadly predators. First up, Steve heads out onto the waterways in search of the small but deadly dwarf crocodile. Despite the fact that it is one of the smallest crocodiles on earth, its bite packs a mighty punch. With the help of local guides Yuri and Kharl, Steve hopes they will strike lucky. However, crocodiles arent the only animals you can bump into at night - Gabons infamous forest elephants are lurking in the shadows. They may look like the savannah elephants seen all over Africa, but they are very different. After spotting a few footprints at night, Steve and the team decide looking for them in the day will be a much better idea - but these giants arent that easy to find. Luckily, Yuri and Kharls tracking skills are second to none. They have learned them from their time as poachers. Turning their lives around, they are now protecting this incredible species and helping to save it from poachers like the ones they used to be. Steve finally captures his first glimpse of these phenomenal animals - but it doesnt end there. Next up, Steve has the unique opportunity to go tracking with the Loango Chimpanzee Project. Very few people have seen these animals, and Steve cant wait to get out there. It doesnt take long for the researchers to find them, but they are on the move and keeping up with a group of chimpanzees isnt easy. Luckily, Steve gets the amazing opportunity to sit and watch them as they take a rest. He witnesses one of the chimpanzees taking a tortoise up into the canopy to eat. They are the only species of chimpanzee in the world known to prey on tortoises, smashing their shells against trees to eat the insides. Meanwhile, another group are digging up a bees nest - there really is no end to the ingenuity of these animals! However, their story isnt entirely a happy one - chimpanzees are still suffering as their habitat is destroyed, and they are taken and killed as a part of the bushmeat trade. This is not only deadly to the chimpanzees but to humans too, as many lethal diseases are passed between the species. Finally, Steve encounters a forest elephant out in the open - something he and the crew will never forget.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures deep into the Black Forest on a quest to discover the essence of Germany and discovers how Hansel and Gretel helped to unify the nation. A humbling masterclass in carving cuckoo clocks shows him how the nations reputation for quality and reliability in manufacturing was established from the early 18th century. A romantic stop at the ruined Schloss in Heidelberg follows before Michael gets an insiders guide to share dealing on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. At Goettingen University, Michael discovers two sides of student life at the turn of the 20th century - the duelling fraternities and the groundbreaking scientists who laid the foundation for Germanys world-class transport technology today. Braving the force of the Goettingen wind tunnel, Michael investigates the track where model trains are fired at up to 360km per hour.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Join journeyman Ben Fogle as he visits snowboarding legend Mike Basich – a man who left the fame and riches of professional sport to reconnect with the natural environment and pursue a quieter life in the Sierra Nevada mountains. Ben joins him in his extraordinary hand-built log cabin and finds out how Mike got his kicks by pushing his body to the edge, explores why he left that lifestyle behind and joins him as he embarks on a life-changing project. Ben meets Mike in his winter snowscape utopia. Together they explore the mountain on skis and embrace Mikes genius for mechanics, metalwork and woodwork – which he has utilised for tree felling, solar electrics, a homemade hot tub and his very own ski lift. Ben discovers there are three sides to his host – mountain Mike, workshop Mike and family Mike and finds out how he makes these work together. Ben learns how when not one, but two disasters struck, a community rallied together to help Mike and his family on their new journey in the mountains.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben journeys to South America to visit Rhona, a British-born actress who left Hollywood to live alone in a remote valley in Uruguay. He learns that a difficult childhood and disillusionment with Tinseltown culture led to his hosts new life. She is now committed to rehabilitating horses and the pair attend an animal auction looking to rescue any mistreated animals. Series/ Exec Prod: Natalie Wilkinson; Prod Co: Renegade Pictures

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Changing landscapes and animal patterns threaten the survival of those who dwell in the arctic. The Hailstones search for a once abundant food source quickly turns to desperation.

programme.title: Dešifreeritud aarded
programme.desc: Hadrians Wall once formed the N/W frontier of the Roman Empire. However new evidence reveals how the ruthless Roman military crossed over and took the fight to their enemy.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace explores the largest bicycle factory in Britain which produces 150 folding bicycles every 24 hours and joins a multi-stage manual production line to make his very own bike. Hell learn how to put together 1200 individual parts and attempt to braze a bike frame together using extreme heat of a thousand degrees, a skill that takes years to master. Hell also visit a leather saddle maker in Birmingham thats been making saddles for 150 years and discover how they use cowhide from UK and Ireland cows because the cold weather means they have thicker skins. Meanwhile Cherry Healey gets some tips from Cycling Team GB to help us all improve our pedal power, including how lowering your body position can make a 10% improvement to speed and efficiency. She also learns how to paint a bike frame fit for the British weather using an electro-static charge and a 180 degree hot oven; and investigates why cyclists and trucks are such a deadly combination: in London alone there have been 66 fatalities since 2011 and half of them were collisions with a truck. And historian Ruth Goodman reveals that folding bikes date back to the 1870s, and how 70,000 folding "parabikes" were manufactured during World War II, some of which played a role in the D-Day landings. Shell also find out how the invention of the safety bicycle in the late 1880s was used by Suffragettes to ride to rallies and spread the word in their fight for equality.

programme.title: Planeet Maa III
programme.desc: Selles osas naeme, kuidas saavad loomad hakkama aarmuslikes tingimustes. Vietnamis uhes maailma suurimas koopas elavad pimedad kalad. Ellesmerei saare karmi talvega seisavad silmitsi nii hundid kui ka nende iidsed vaenlased muskusveised. Naeme ka põuases savannis elavaid elevante, Gobi kõrbe lumeleoparde ja teisi aarmustega rinda pistvaid loomi.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaws Guide, Michael Portillo returns to Spain to trace the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his Spanish family and sent his father into exile. He discovers a nation fractured at the time by social tensions and regional loyalties, which today offers a rich diversity of cultures to delight the tourist. Special dispensation to fly to the Balearic island of Mallorca allows Michael to spoil himself rotten with spectacularly scenic rides aboard a sublime 1912 vintage railway and a 1913 tram. On his travels, he is trampled underfoot at the bottom of a Catalan people steeple and learns to make the perfect paella. He pays homage to the genius of Barcelonas most famous architect and meets the man responsible for finishing off Antoni Gaudis lifes work. And he discovers a beautiful art nouveau Palace of Music with an emotional history.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: The last of the snow melts in Alaska, and residents of the arctic make hay while the midnight sun shines. After a lean winter, Andy Bassich and Denise Becker search for fertile hunting grounds.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: In this series, Ben joins a variety of brave individuals whove chosen to venture down a very alternative path to everyday life in search of something different, ranging from a former American sports star now living in a log cabin in the mountains, a Hollywood actress whos swapped the bright lights for a horse sanctuary in Uruguay to a British couple living at the top of an Italian mountain and a single dad living homeless in the wilds of Oregon. This week, Ben Fogle heads Down Under to visit Bette, an elderly lady living alone in a ramshackle house in the wilds of northern Queensland. Ben quickly encounters Bettes no-nonsense personality, and her refusal to cook leaves him with no choice but to attempt dinner himself. It doesnt go well. As the week progresses, Bette warms to her guest and explains what drew her to the harsh Australian wilderness 30 years ago. Despite snakes, floods and the isolation, Bette loves her home and reveals that shes been seriously threatened when defending the natural world around her from development. Her complex relationship with men also surprises and saddens Ben. The longer this unlikely pair spend together, the stronger their bond becomes, resulting in heartfelt tears, a lot of laughing and some very dodgy dancing.

programme.title: Dešifreeritud aarded
programme.desc: Stonehenge, the site whose origins have baffled historians for centuries. Yet now, a discovery on the bed of the Mediterranean sea floor could hold some new clues.

programme.title: Mammals
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the series that explores the most successful animal group on Earth, from the tiny Etruscan shrew to the largest mammal in existence - the blue whale.

programme.title: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Robson Green walks in the footsteps of the brave soldiers of the D-Day landings in Normandy, France, on an emotional journey of sacrifice and courage.

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Mike Wozniak and Ola Labib head to one of the wildest places on Earth - the Namib desert - to meet for the first time and have each other for company on their journey.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben Fogle is in Alaska battling mosquitoes and eating bear.

programme.title: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Robson Green walks a beautiful but lesser-known route in the Douro Valley in Northern Portugal, rich in ancient art, wildlife and world-famous wine.

programme.title: Võimatu kalastus
programme.desc: Documentary series in which three fishermen travel the globe with the aim of landing fish that are considered impossible to catch. The trio head to Laos on the hunt for a feared predator - the devil catfish. To stand any chance of catching one, they will have to find the ideal spot and use the perfect bait. Their journey through Laos takes them along the mighty Mekong River, gathering knowledge and some pretty smelly bait on the way.

programme.title: Deadly Mission Shark
programme.desc: Steve Backshall has two weeks to get ten children trained for a shark dive.

programme.title: Deadly Mission Shark
programme.desc: Steve Backshall has two weeks to get ten children trained for a shark dive.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve and his trusty crew embark on an epic journey to a remote corner of Norway to experience a very special wildlife spectacle. Each year in November millions of herring pass through this area and deadly predators arent far behind. For the first time ever Steve will be attempting to get in the water with one of these ultimate underwater hunters, the killer whale or orca. But first He needs to find them. Heading out on the fjords, everyones eyes are peeled for the iconic dorsal fin. Reaching the height of Steve, it is hard to miss, and they finally spot a group in the distance. With the whales on the move, its time for Steve to attempt to get his first underwater view of these ultimate animals. But as they are as fast as an Olympic swimmer, keeping up with them is tricky. He finally captures his first underwater glimpse, and the sound of their clicks as they chat away to each other is just beautiful. But Steve wants to do better, and he knows just what to try. The orca in Norway have learnt a very unique way of finding their food: they follow the fishing boats, since where there are fishing boats, there are guaranteed to be herring. To witness this, Steve and the team head out in the dead of night. It wont be easy, though, as so many factors have to come together to make it work: the weather, the animals and the timing of the fishermens catch. The first attempt is a failure, but the team will not give up. As well as the orca mission, Steve and the team get to see the magical northern lights like never before and have an encounter with a mighty humpback they will never forget.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaws Guide, Michael Portillo returns to Spain to trace the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his Spanish family and sent his father into exile. programme.title: BBC World News America
programme.desc: News presenter Katty Kay keeps you up to date with all the latest breaking news from America and the rest of the world on BBC World News America. This world renowned news and current affairs program has been recognised for its exceptional reporting at the Emmy Awards. BBC World News America won two Emmy awards for its coverage of the conflicts in Syria and the Central African Republic. You can catch up with this award winning broadcast team as they air multiple times a day throughout the week.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: In-depth news and current affairs review of the main political and economic stories of the day, featuring robust interviews with senior government and opposition figures, business and union leaders, and analytical reports that delve behind the headlines. Regular presenters cross-examine studio guests on details of policies, priorities, actions and inactions, on a range of domestic UK and international topics. There are weekly features on the arts, sports and the world of technology, and editors are not afraid to venture into niche, specialist and exotic areas from space travel to animal psychology. If the BBCs flagship Radio 4 Today programme sets the early morning news agenda for the day, then its late-night TV equivalent often gives the people in power some sleepless nights.

programme.title: BBC World News America
programme.desc: News presenter Katty Kay keeps you up to date with all the latest breaking news from America and the rest of the world on BBC World News America. This world renowned news and current affairs program has been recognised for its exceptional reporting at the Emmy Awards. BBC World News America won two Emmy awards for its coverage of the conflicts in Syria and the Central African Republic. You can catch up with this award winning broadcast team as they air multiple times a day throughout the week.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC,which is designed to inform you on current affairs. The BBC is aims to be a totally impartial public service broadcaster, and was established by Royal Charter. The BBC is funded by a licence fee paid by British households, and is regulated by Ofcom. They aim to create high-quality content, in order to inform and educate, but also entertain, their audience Millions of people from all over the world watch content produced by the BBC, and they are well respected as a media company. It was founded in 1922, with its headquarters in Westminster, London.

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Join BBC journalists including political editor Laura Kuenssberg, Europe editor Katya Adler, Brussels correspondent Adam Fleming and political correspondent Chris Mason in their weekly podcast discussing all of the news stories that matter to the people of the United Kingdom. The journalists know all about the stories that theyre talking about - they interview the most important people involved in the stories that feature in the news. They speak of their knowledge and understanding of the news in a way that is understandable for all. Laura is often in a car in the middle of a city where big politics stories are happening. Katya, Adam and Chris are usually in the studio. They regularly talk about Brexit and what is going to happen when the United Kingdom leaves the European Union.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC,which is designed to inform you on current affairs. The BBC is aims to be a totally impartial public service broadcaster, and was established by Royal Charter. The BBC is funded by a licence fee paid by British households, and is regulated by Ofcom. They aim to create high-quality content, in order to inform and educate, but also entertain, their audience Millions of people from all over the world watch content produced by the BBC, and they are well respected as a media company. It was founded in 1922, with its headquarters in Westminster, London.

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: On Talking Business BBC presenters, based in the worlds most dynamic cities, discuss with the most important and influential people from the world of business and finance, the key issues of the day. Corporate leaders, global investors, top creatives, cutting-edge entrepreneurs and leading intellectuals gather together weekly to discuss and analyse the issues and trends that most affect how business has to work in todays world. Our team of presenters are experts on the issues and developments which are shaping the way we work, consume and live in the 21st Century.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: "Good Morning Asia, hello World." Join the news teams from BBC World News in London and Singapore. This live news and current affairs program is broadcast globally and focuses on all the latest news and breaking developing stories that matter around the world. The show is usually presented by Rico Hizon in Singapore and Kasia Madera in London. Broadcasting live at midnight GMT on both BBC World News and the BBC News channel, the show is broadcast in the morning in Asia and therefore is marketed as a morning show for people watching around the country. The show is often followed by Asia Business Report live from Singapore which reports on all the latest economy and business figures from the country.

programme.title: Business Today
programme.desc: The latest business news from Singapore and around the world.

programme.title: BBC Sport
programme.desc: A round-up of the days sporting action.

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: Join the Travel Show team as they take you on a criss-cross journey across the globe, visiting the most popular holiday destinations as well as sampling some hidden gems. The itinerary includes up-and-coming hot spots for holidaymakers and uncovering some lesser-known facts about places on many peoples bucket lists. This BBC programme takes you to every corner of the planet, providing an all-round insight into the world of travel. From winter wonderland activities such as eco skiing in Denmark and trekking across glaciers in Iceland, to warmer destinations as diverse as Rwanda and the Great Barrier Reef in Australia, your adventure starts here.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC,which is designed to inform you on current affairs. The BBC is aims to be a totally impartial public service broadcaster, and was established by Royal Charter. The BBC is funded by a licence fee paid by British households, and is regulated by Ofcom. They aim to create high-quality content, in order to inform and educate, but also entertain, their audience Millions of people from all over the world watch content produced by the BBC, and they are well respected as a media company. It was founded in 1922, with its headquarters in Westminster, London.

programme.title: BBC Focus on Africa
programme.desc: Focus on Africa is a BBC news program broadcast globally and on local partner channels of the BBC in African countries. The program used to be presented by Komla Dumor each weekday from its inception until his death in 2014; now it is hosted by Sophie Ikenye, a news presenter from Kenya. The program includes news, sport and business from across Africa and the rest of the globe. Get the top African stories and keep up with the latest international events.

programme.title: BBC World News America
programme.desc: News presenter Katty Kay keeps you up to date with all the latest breaking news from America and the rest of the world on BBC World News America. This world renowned news and current affairs program has been recognised for its exceptional reporting at the Emmy Awards. BBC World News America won two Emmy awards for its coverage of the conflicts in Syria and the Central African Republic. You can catch up with this award winning broadcast team as they air multiple times a day throughout the week.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: In-depth news and current affairs review of the main political and economic stories of the day, featuring robust interviews with senior government and opposition figures, business and union leaders, and analytical reports that delve behind the headlines. Regular presenters cross-examine studio guests on details of policies, priorities, actions and inactions, on a range of domestic UK and international topics. There are weekly features on the arts, sports and the world of technology, and editors are not afraid to venture into niche, specialist and exotic areas from space travel to animal psychology. If the BBCs flagship Radio 4 Today programme sets the early morning news agenda for the day, then its late-night TV equivalent often gives the people in power some sleepless nights.

programme.title: BBC World News America
programme.desc: News presenter Katty Kay keeps you up to date with all the latest breaking news from America and the rest of the world on BBC World News America. This world renowned news and current affairs program has been recognised for its exceptional reporting at the Emmy Awards. BBC World News America won two Emmy awards for its coverage of the conflicts in Syria and the Central African Republic. You can catch up with this award winning broadcast team as they air multiple times a day throughout the week.

programme.title: BBC News

They aim to create high-quality content, in order to inform and educate, but also entertain, their audience Millions of people from all over the world watch content produced by the BBC, and they are well respected as a media company. It was founded in 1922, with its headquarters in Westminster, London.

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Join BBC journalists including political editor Laura Kuenssberg, Europe editor Katya Adler, Brussels correspondent Adam Fleming and political correspondent Chris Mason in their weekly podcast discussing all of the news stories that matter to the people of the United Kingdom. The journalists know all about the stories that theyre talking about - they interview the most important people involved in the stories that feature in the news. They speak of their knowledge and understanding of the news in a way that is understandable for all. Laura is often in a car in the middle of a city where big politics stories are happening. Katya, Adam and Chris are usually in the studio. They regularly talk about Brexit and what is going to happen when the United Kingdom leaves the European Union.

programme.title: BBC News

programme.desc: Nick Kwek visits the National Space Industry Hub in Sydney.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: "Good Morning Asia, hello World." Join the news teams from BBC World News in London and Singapore. This live news and current affairs program is broadcast globally and focuses on all the latest news and breaking developing stories that matter around the world. The show is usually presented by Rico Hizon in Singapore and Kasia Madera in London. Broadcasting live at midnight GMT on both BBC World News and the BBC News channel, the show is broadcast in the morning in Asia and therefore is marketed as a morning show for people watching around the country. The show is often followed by Asia Business Report live from Singapore which reports on all the latest economy and business figures from the country.

programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC,which is designed to inform you on current affairs. The BBC is aims to be a totally impartial public service broadcaster, and was established by Royal Charter. The BBC is funded by a licence fee paid by British households, and is regulated by Ofcom. They aim to create high-quality content, in order to inform and educate, but also entertain, their audience Millions of people from all over the world watch content produced by the BBC, and they are well respected as a media company. It was founded in 1922, with its headquarters in Westminster, London.

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Join BBC journalists including political editor Laura Kuenssberg, Europe editor Katya Adler, Brussels correspondent Adam Fleming and political correspondent Chris Mason in their weekly podcast discussing all of the news stories that matter to the people of the United Kingdom. The journalists know all about the stories that theyre talking about - they interview the most important people involved in the stories that feature in the news. They speak of their knowledge and understanding of the news in a way that is understandable for all. Laura is often in a car in the middle of a city where big politics stories are happening. Katya, Adam and Chris are usually in the studio. They regularly talk about Brexit and what is going to happen when the United Kingdom leaves the European Union.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: "Good Morning Asia, hello World." Join the news teams from BBC World News in London and Singapore. This live news and current affairs program is broadcast globally and focuses on all the latest news and breaking developing stories that matter around the world. The show is usually presented by Rico Hizon in Singapore and Kasia Madera in London. Broadcasting live at midnight GMT on both BBC World News and the BBC News channel, the show is broadcast in the morning in Asia and therefore is marketed as a morning show for people watching around the country. The show is often followed by Asia Business Report live from Singapore which reports on all the latest economy and business figures from the country.
